alfredsnippet.snippet:
"... this tendency to classify the work as non-mathematical would be of no particular consequence and would not call for any special comment, were it not for the further tendency on the part of the physicists to regard the adjective 'non-mathematical' as synonymous with 'defective' or 'unacceptable,' and to adhere to what Northrop calls 'the scientific dogma that nothing is truly scientific which is not mathematical.'"

- Northrop, F. S. C., Science and First Principles, The Macmillan Co., New York, 1932, p.28
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Non-Mathematical As Synonymous With Defective
